definition: (of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to

sentences.english: Sudden prostration due to exposure to the sun or excessive heat.
sentences.chinese: 由於曝曬或過熱而導致突然腑倒。

sentences.english: If you expose your skin to too much sun, you will get sunburned .
sentences.chinese: 如果你過度曝曬在陽光下的話就會曬傷。

sentences.english: If you expose your skin to too much sunlight, you will get sunburned .
sentences.chinese: 如果你過於曝曬在陽光下的話，就會曬傷。

sentences.english: The stress of people exposed to the radiation of totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 曝曬在極權主義輻射之下的人們所承受的壓力。

sentences.english: It's a well-known fact that shunning the sunscreen and basking in direct sun leads to wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，不塗防曬霜就在太陽底下曝曬會長皺紋。

sentences.english: The lush wetland shrivels to a jig-saw landscape of dried sun-baked mud.
sentences.chinese: 翠綠的溼地在烈日下曝曬幹縮成鋸齒般乾土景觀。

sentences.english: Smoking and exposure to the sun are what ages skin the most.
sentences.chinese: 吸菸或曝曬最易使皮膚衰老。

sentences.english: Don't overexpose yourself to the sun without sun-cream.
sentences.chinese: 在不擦防曬霜的情況下，不要曝曬於太陽之下。

definition: (of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
(idiom) to be exposed to the elements
scorched and drenched by sun and rain (idiom); suffer from exposure to the elements/weather-beaten
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
